reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

description.narrative: Uganda - Malaria - The AIDS Support Organisation (Uganda) Limited - TASO. This program has the following goals: By 2025, reduce malaria morbidity by 50% and alaria related mortality by 75% of 2019 levels. The objectives of this program are: Accelerate access to malaria preventative and curative services to achieve universal coverage in all eligible populations by 2025. Enhance quality of care of malariaservices in atleast 80% of private health facilities managing malaria according to national guidelines and reporting quality data by 2025. By 2025, atleast 90% of the population sustains the the acquired knowledge, utilizes and practices correct malaria prevention, control and management measures. Malaria programming at all levels guided and based on robust data and evidence. By 2025, transform malaria programmingin targeted districts from control to elimination. By 2025, 80% of the districts will have strengthened enabling enviroment to deliver malaria inteventions and measure progress through coordinated partnership and multisectoral collaboration

title.narrative: Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at private sector sites
CM-other 1: Proportion of VHTs conducting Malaria tests at community level
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment in the community
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
Percentage of service delivery reports from community health workers integrated into HMIS
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to targeted risk groups through continuous distribution
Proportion of pregnant women attending antenatal clinics who received three or more doses of intermittent preventive treatment for malaria
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at private sector sites
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
CM-other 2: Number of VHTs/supervisors trained in ICCM
